wordpressPost.title: Melatonin can stimulate your immune system
wordpressPost.content:
Melatonin can stimulate your immune system

As we get older, our thymus gland, spleen and bone marrow (immune system) begins to go into atrophy (wasting away).  In medical studies, these functions can be recouped my taking the supplement, Melatonin.

Melatonin can recharge our immune system that’s been undermined by age related declines.  We have receptor sites on the surface of our thymus gland, spleen and in our bone marrow cells.

If we add Melatonin to our supplement program, it appears that these cells can be revived!

Melatonin is also likely to protect our lymphocytes (white blood cells) against the effects of radiation. So in essence one might take a dose of Melatonin before going under any radiation treatment or X-rays.

Besides the benefits of helping us sleep as a supplement for insomnia, some are asking if Melatonin is a medical marvel or a medical myth?

Of course we need a lot more research for the use of Melatonin however, I would say that I take it every night for sleep and it lives up to my expectations.  If I get a recharged immune system as a side effect well, that’s even better!

Did you know that Melatonin is a hormone?  Yep! I was surprised to learn that and then worried that I was taking a hormone and we all know what some hormones can do and that is to possibly raise our cancer risk.  However, studies have found that Melatonin is absolutely safe.

If you have a serious illness such as leukemia, lymphoma, an autoimmune disorder or major depression it will be wise for you to consult your doctor before taking Melatonin.  If you’re pregnant don’t take it either.

Melatonin provides anti-aging effects without poisoning any of our body’s organs.  It actually fosters internal harmony.  There is no toxic risk, no dependency, or adverse effects.

I’ll keep you updated on what else I find out about it.  Until then, you should probably consider Melatonin.
